titleStmt.title: James S. Ohair et al. to Unknown
CWG9233

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Wolfe county
Sct

The undersigned; all Bonafied house keepers & good citizens of Wolfe county Ky States that Nicholas Fulks formerly of this county was a Young man of good moral character at the time that he left this place. He was a poor orphan boy but strictly honest & industrious. & that if he is guilty of the crime with which he is charged hhe was led into it by cunning villians whose design it was to destroy him & keep their own head out of the hatter These villiams are numerous in this place & well calculated to destroy the most most honest hearted young men in this country & as he has been brought up in such a country without parents & without the means of support only what he honestly laboured for They the undersigned plead petition to your honor for his release from prison Given from under our hands

Names of Signers

Isaac Peck
Wm. A. tutt
